Package cz.syntea.xdef.sys

Support for reporting, exceptions, parsing tools and collection of useful classes.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BNFExtMethod
    Interface for external method object.
    BNFRule
    Provides BNF grammar rule.
    Reporter
    Interface for reporters.
    ReportReader
    Interface for processing tables of source report messages.
    ReportWriter
    Interface for writing reports to streams of reports.
    SConstants
    Constants (build date and version, java version, XML library).
    SParser
    Describes interface of source parsers.
    SParserSavedObject
    Interface for parser saved object.
    SThrowable
    Interface for exceptions extended with Syntea reporting tools.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ArrayReporter
    Implements both (ReportWriter and ReportReader interfaces) using ArrayList.
    BinReportReader
    Reader of binary form of report data.
    BinReportWriter
    Writer of binary form of report data.
    BNFGrammar
    Provides BNF grammar parsing.
    ExtensionFileFilter
    Implements FileFilter for files with given extension (suffix).
    FileReportReader
    Implementation of ReportReader interface for input streams and/or files.
    FileReportWriter
    Implements the ReportWriter interface for output streams and/or files.
    FUtils
    Collection of utilities to handle with files.
    GenDataClass
    Provides generation of Java source class containing data from argument (see method genClass).
    JSONUtil
    Provides methods for conversion from JSON to XML, conversion from XML to JSON and for comparing of JSON objects.
    NullReportWriter
    Implementation of ReportWriter to null stream.
    RegisterReportTables
    Provides tools for generation Java class source registered table and for report tables.
    Report
    Provides container of a report.
    ReportPrinter
    Static methods for printing listings of parsed source.
    SBuffer
    Contains string connected with source position.
    SDatetime
    Implementation of date and time values.
    SDuration
    Provides operations with date and time periods (see ISO 8061).
    SManager
    Provides managing of properties, languages and report tables.
    SObjectReader
    Provides reading of SObjects to output stream.
    SObjectWriter
    Provides writing of SObjects to output stream.
    SPosition
    Source position.
    SReporter
    Reporting with source position.
    STester
    Abstract class for creating test classes.
    StringParser
    String parser used for constructing specific parsers.
    SUtils
    Collection of useful methods.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description

    Extension of java.lang.Exception with SThrowable interface.

    Extension of IllegalArgumentException implementing SThrowable interface.

    Extension of java.io.IOException with SThrowable interface.

    Extension of NullPointerException implementing SThrowable interface.

    Extension of java.text.ParseException with SThrowable interface.
    SRuntimeException
    Extension of java.lang.RuntimeException with SThrowable interface.
    SUnsupportedOperationException
    Extension of SUnsupportedOperationException implementing SThrowable interface.
  • Error Summary 
    Error Description
    SError
    Extension of java.lang.Error with implementation of SThrowable interface.
    SExternalError
    Extension of java.lang.Error with SThrowable interface.

Package cz.syntea.xdef.sys Description

Support for reporting, exceptions, parsing tools and collection of useful classes.

Reports, report files and exceptions

Provides flexible tool for reporting with multi language support. The reports are instances of Report. The report objects have the attribute "type" which classifies the type of report (such as "ERROR", WARNINING, INFO etc). The report object may be "registered" - i.e. the report may have the ID (the string, which identifies the report. If the ID is specified, the text of report may be found in the report table and report table may contain localized texts in different languages. The text of reports may is modified by parameters specified in the report text. If the report ID is null (the unregistered report) or if the report ID is not found in report table the "default" report text specified by the constructor of Report object. If the localized report for given language is not found it is used the English version of the report.The default language is set as to the static variable assigned to Report object at the initialization time and it is taken from system properties of Java virtual machine. However, the user can set it by the static method Report.setLanguage(String). The language ID may be two letters accodring to either ISO-639 or three letters according to ISO-639-2 specifications (see method SUtils.getISO3Language() and SUtils.getISO3Language(String). The files with localized report texts are in the XML format. Each report is declared in the separated element whith the tag name equal to report ID. The text of report is in the attribute which has name equal to three letters ISO-639-2 code. There are two possibilities how to maintain the files with localized report texts:

  • all localized report texts are in one file

    Example: 
    
                <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
                <messages>
                <MSG012 eng="This is a message" deu="Das ist ein Nachricht" />
                </messages>

  • localized report are separated to different documents. The name of each document in this case MUST end with characters "_"lng".xml" where lng is ISO-639-2 of given language. This helps to maintain the localized reports separately and enables to add some localization separately. Also the size of report files are smaller and its processing is faster.

    The reports from the above example are separated to two files, say "msg_eng.xml" with English version: 
    
                <?xml version="1.0" encoding="ASCII"?>
                <messages>
                <MSG012 eng="This is a message" />
                </messages>
    and "msg_deu.xml" with German version: 
    
                <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
                <messages>
                <MSG012 deu="Das ist ein Nachricht" />
                </messages>

    Report objects can be converted to strings

  • thrown as the parameter of exceptions (see SException, SRuntimeException, SError or SExternalError),
  • written to the output stream (see ReportWriter). The files created by ReportWriter may be read with ReportReader.

    The classes providing reading and writing of reports are FileReportReader and FileReportWriter. See also and ArrayReporter which provides both read and write interfaces and it is useful as th temporary buffer of reports.

RegisterReportTables

Creates Java source code of registered report tables from XML document. See RegisterReportTables.

Parsing tools

Parsing of data is provided with implementation of the SParser interface (see SParser).There is available the class implementing methods for strings, streams or files (see StringParser). It provids number of methods for error and reporting connected with the possibility to give to user the information about the source position. Complex syntax of source data you can describe and process with extended Backus Naur form (see BNFGrammar).

Collection of system utilities methods

Collection of useful methods which help the user to cooperate with the different operating systems independent way. Methods are designed as static methods of the classes SUtils and FUtils.

Serializing of objects

Primitive values and objects (e.g. Report, SDatetime, SDuration etc.) can be written to an Ouput stream by the class SObjectWriter and you car read them by SObjectReader.

For generation of unique IDs you can use for multi VM

STester

  • STester is the abstract class which provides tools for testing. This class requires following structure of directories:

    build/classes src/javaSource_dataDir[/dataDir] or test/javaSource_dataDir[/dataDir]

    See STester.
